definition:
An [*impractical number*]{} $n$ is an even abundant number that is not a
practical number under the second definition. The first few impractical
numbers are 70, 102, 114, 138, 174, 186, 222, 246, 258, 282, 318, 350,
354, 366, 372, 402, 426, 438, 444, 474, 490, 492, 498; these are listed
in A007621 of Sloane’s OEIS.
